name: prejudgment
content:

an opinion about a situation or a person that is formed before knowing or considering all of the facts: You shouldn't make any sort of prejudgment about her before you've met her. The public expects fairness and impartiality and not prejudgments. See
prejudge
More examplesFewer examplesHe found the prejudgment by parts of the media to be particularly offensive.Lawyers felt there was a lot of prejudgment and bias present in the case.Prejudice comes from prejudgment and lack of information.
